TopicTitle: Glowing parts and bars that don't tell me anything.

Articles.Content:
Hi, look at the pictures that I show below.

Anyone know if I have a mod that shows these things, or if it is vanilla?

I do not wish to see this, so If anyone know how to turn it of, please tell me.

![D8jHnst.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/D8jHnst.png?1)
yeah, that's the new stock temperature gauges. It is kind of annoying, I'd love a way to turn that off.

Ya, I definitely do not like those. Especially since they are not particularly informative. But to answer your questions no you can turn them off F10, and they are part of stock KSP.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T04:26:30Z" title="05/04/2015 04:26  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by mcirish3**
  
Correction; you can turn off the temp gauges
Anyone else notice things don't cool in space?
They cool, just slowly. There's no convection, so radiation (and conduction to other parts) is the only way for the ship to cool off.
There is also a "[temerature gaudge killer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120731-1-0-2-Temperature-Gauge-Killer)" mod that saves you from pressing F10 all the time.

Pressing F10 however doesn't disable the incredibly rushed and ugly part highlights that show if something is overheating. [HeatWarning](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116773-1-0-HeatWarning/) seems to disable this, however, and provides a better and memory leak free replacement for the stock temperature gauges.
